Interacting with Customers
Customer
Technician
Click Play to view how to handle a customer call.
Good morning. This is the ZYX help desk. I am Mark. How can I help you today?
Be prepared to answer the customer call in accordance with the company customer service policies. Answer the call in a courteous manner and immediately identify yourself and the company.
Hello Mark, I am having trouble getting to the Internet to get my email this morning.
May I have your name and contract number? I will need to retrieve your information to open a trouble ticket.
Ask for the customer contact information. Keep the customer informed of what you are doing and why you need the information.
Sure, Mark, I am Mary Davis and my contract number is M345-678.
Ms. Davis, is your company still located at 2356 West 14th Street? Our records show that you connect to us through a Linksys router.
Follow the help desk script, begin by verifying the information in the customer record.
Yes, the information is correct. Will this take very long? We really need access to the email.

Ms. Davis, I understand that email is critical to your company. I will try to resolve this as quickly as possible. First, I need some additional information to get started. When did this problem first begin?
Show empathy for the customer. Make sure the customer understands that you will do everything necessary to solve the problem as quickly as possible.
We first noticed it when we came in this morning. The power was out for a short time last night, the time on our clocks is off by an hour.
Are you able to reach any web sites or other Internet services?
Continue following the script, recording all of the information on the trouble ticket.
No, it appears that we are unable to reach the Internet.
Ms. Davis, may I put you on hold for a short time, while I check the status of the connection from our site to your company router?
Always ask for permission to place the customer on hold. Keep the customer informed as to what you are doing and why.
Yes, I will wait.
Ms. Davis, it looks like the connection is functioning. Are you near the Linksys router? Are you or someone at your location able to reset the router?
Avoid using technical terms or jargon, unless the customer does. Always ask if the customer is comfortable performing a task before instructing them to do so.
Yes, what do I need to do?

Locate the power cord. Unplug the cord and wait a few seconds. Plug the cord back in and wait for the router to power up. The lights on the front indicate when it is ready. It may take a minute for the router to fully power up. Then try your computer to see if you can get your email.
Communicate what to do in plain language, including all of the necessary steps.
Thank you! That seems to have fixed the problem.
Is there anything else that I can do for you today? If not, I will close this trouble ticket.
Verify that the customer is satisfied and close the trouble ticket.
No, everything seems to be working now. Thank you.
